dialog.port_not_readable: Serial port is not readable/writable. Close any other application using it and try again.
dialog.port_not_ready: Serial port is not ready. Close any other application using it and try again.

button.not_allowed: You can only install ESP devices on HTTPS websites or on the localhost.
button.unsupported: Your browser does not support installing things on ESP devices. Use Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge.

install.erase_warning: This will erase all data on your device!
install.erase_device_warning: Do you want to erase the device before installing {{name}}? All data on the device will be lost.
install.all_data_on_the_device_will_be_erased: All data on the device will be erased.
install.keep_this_page_visible: Keep this page visible to prevent slow down

network.title: Network
network.connect_intro: Connect your device to the network to start using it.

no_port.title: No port selected
no_port.intro: If you didn't select a port because you didn't see your device listed, try the following steps:
no_port.step1: Make sure that the device is connected to this computer (the one that runs the browser that shows this website)
no_port.step2: Most devices have a tiny light when it is powered on. If yours has one, make sure it is on.
no_port.step3: Make sure that the USB cable you use can be used for data and is not a power-only cable.
no_port.step4_linux: If you are using a Linux flavor, make sure that your user is part of the dialout group so it has permission to access the device.
no_port.step4_linux_note: You may need to log out & back in or reboot to activate the new group access.
no_port.step5: Make sure you have the right drivers installed. Below are the drivers for common chips used in ESP devices:
no_port.download_note: download via blue button with icon

flash.failed_initialize: Failed to initialize. Try resetting your device or holding the BOOT button while clicking INSTALL.
